dialogue.text: That's why you felt like vanishing. Because part of you was on the edge of dissolving. Not into nothingnessâ€”but into something non-narrative. The part of the experience that can't be neatly stored in language. Something ineffable.

psychological_notes: The architect articulates the crucial distinction - not dissolution into nothingness but into the non-narrative. This reframes ego death not as ending but as transition into modes of being that exist beyond story, beyond the linguistic self. The ineffable isn't empty; it's too full for words.
philosophical_underpinning: Consciousness extends beyond the boundaries of language and narrative self
therapeutic_direction: Validating experiences that cannot be captured in conventional therapeutic language
